intro: Hieracium filicauloides, commonly known as the fern-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. It is an annual or biennial plant that produces a large number of seeds, contributing to its widespread distribution.
